book.synopsis: An outbreak of kleptomania at a student hostel was not normally the sort of crime that aroused Hercule Poirot"s interest. But then he saw the list of stolen and vandalized items: a stethoscope, some old flannel trousers, a box of chocolates, a slashed rucksack, and a diamond ring found in a bowl of soup. He congratulated the warden, Mrs. Hubbard, on a
book.title_long: Hickory Dickory Dock: A Hercule Poirot Mystery
